website_summaries.verdict: A portable toilet with a disposable bag system.
pros: Cleanup is very easy and fast
Can handle people of all sizes
Uses a bucket to hold waste
cons: This bucket is a little short for taller people to use comfortably

customer_reviews.title: fits in this hassock.  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I think it was worth the money--not a lot--but it is very cheaply made. I wanted to make it really function as a secondary seat--which it is too short (never mind too obvious) to do normally. So I went through the process of obtaining a hassock seat for it to sit inside Had to buy three to get a match so I thought I'd pass this along. BEST Octagonal Folding Ottoman, Blue  This was a great improvement, though the hassock is a bit too deep so adding a layer of cut 2x4s to the bottom of the space was necessary. The combination is fantastic--makes the original product much more useful IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Forbzilla

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment of My Life
customer_reviews.text: I hate using park/camping toilets! We have a 3 room tent and put this toilet at one end of the tent with a divider up. Didn't use the public toilets the entire trip. We used 2 black trash bags and poured a few inches of cat litter in. After a few uses we would just add another couple of handfuls of litter. After our morning coffee, we would pull the bags, drop them off at the dumpster and start the process over. No smell, the lid stays on snug. Would highly recommend, especially for women.
customer_reviews.author: jessica hale

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: I had no choice but to return this item. It is as others have mentioned quite cheaply made - the seat is flimsy and the plastic is thin but my biggest issue is that it wobbles badly due to an uneven bottom. I tried it on every level surface I could find just to make sure it was the item and not my floor. I even tried it with my weight on it but it wobbled underneath me. I will get something else .....
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money/looked like a good idea, though
customer_reviews.text: There is a hole in the bucket so it leaked into the cover which has a planned hole so it leaked all over the tent. The toilet seat bent/warped the first time it was used. I got that this was inexpensive but they could have spent a little more on the thickness of the toilet seat so it held up for awhile...And...the seat is loosey-goosey on the bucket cover so it just doesn't have a chance. The Grandkids, by the end of the week, were using the toilet seat as a Frisbee.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Compact Necessity
customer_reviews.text: Compact and sturdy. Gets the job done. Made by our quality- minded northern neighbors. The bags are Asian made but seem to be good quality, too. Wish I had bought one years ago. Throw one in your trunk or sleeper berth and enjoy an improved quality of life. Delighted with the purchase. 9/24/17 Would really like to see an accessory for this: a lightweight plastic carrier with big handle that also gripped the lid on. Then this would be perfectly portable!
customer_reviews.author: Pardero

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had looked more into other people's reviews. What I received was a really low quality product. I don't think I've ever actually seen such a low quality plastic product. The bucket doesn't even sit right, it wobbles. The edges are sharp. And I sat on the seat and it was bending - I'm only 135lbs...I don't see how this is supposed to hold up to 250lbs. I almost feel like what I received was refurbished...and feel gross about it. If I don't use it this weekend, it's definitively being returned. Granted I have never used one before and how nothing to compare, this quality is not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Living in my RV most of the time, my toilet failed and I was up a certain creek without a paddle. So I had to get this for an emergency and for only a short time. This was great for my temporary use, easy to use and clean, but not built for the long haul. FYI, the compactor plastic bags found at grocery stores are a hell of a lot cheaper but just not as fancy as the bags sold for this toilet and work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: It looks to be a sturdy "bucket" but it is not
customer_reviews.text: We received this yesterday and we returned it today. It was so flimsy that it arrived with a huge dent it. It's barely big enough for my five year old grandson to sit on it. It looks to be a sturdy "bucket" but it is not. I think a Home Depot bucket with modification would be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Pris

customer_reviews.title: Seat bends and slides off the base when you sit on it
customer_reviews.text: Lots of the positive reviews are from several years ago. I received this product in early 2019 and immediately sat on it, lol. The gray seat/ring part in the picture slides around and slips off the base, and I can feel it bowing because it's made of such cheap plastic. It's probably worth the extremely low price but it may not be in line with what you expect based on the glowing reviews. I expected it to be a lot sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: wild animals

customer_reviews.title: Two cheaply made, seat and lid don't securely fit
customer_reviews.text: Recently received this item, but was thorough disappointed. Neither the seat nor the outer lid seemed to sit securely. My wife took one look at it and said, "Send it back!" Return was very easy with Amazon, and for that we are grateful. Next we will have a look at the same product brand that is supposed to snap onto a standard five-gallon bucket. I'm thinking that must be the better way to go than this. Only need it for cold weather dry camping after our camper is winterized.
customer_reviews.author: Reverse Angle

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good however, the seat part can shift a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I don't have to trek out to the nasty campsite toilets in the middle of the night. Used the Reliance Double Doodie bags with this potty. Quality is good however, the seat part can shift a bit from side to side. Inside the main barrel is a bucket that the liner goes into and a lid for the top. I left off the lid that holds the toilet paper, I think it would have been better to have a hook or something to hang the tp off the main barrel instead. Overall the pot is sturdy was a real life saver when I got stuck in my tent for a while during a rain storm with thunder and lightning.
customer_reviews.author: s.lyn

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The seat is not for an adult ,plus does not lock into place,I am sorry I made this purchase ,I think the seat for the 5 gallon bucket might be a better choice,this would work for a child,only positive is the bucket accepts the typical grocery store plastic bags ,one comment on the reviews was from a man who worked in the plastic industry and he said the bags you buy for this are no more bio biodegradable then any other plastic bag ,just watched a video made by a boondocker and he triple wraps his business in 3 bags then disposes them in a dumpster ,apparently legal ,need to find out more about that
customer_reviews.author: rcknhrse

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous portable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shortly after COVID quarantine began - with 5 kids and no places open to go pee we NEEDED a portable toilet. I keep it in the back of my truck and it has come in handy soooo many times. I wish the seat part locked on a little better but other than that, no complaints. Will be a great addition to our camping gear too. It’s short so for adults it’s quite a squat - but the seat is big enough for me (5’6”) without feeling like I’m sitting on a kid’s toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: Great for those emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is an OTR trucker and wanted something for emergencies on nights when he doesn't have enough hours to get to a truck stop. This works extremely well! He uses it with the Double Doodie bags and says it 1. is not messy 2. is sturdy 3. the bags help keep any smells out of the truck until he can get some place to throw them away. 4. easy to clean and disinfect. It stores well too. In his case, it fits perfectly in the cubby under his bunk.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Life saver for truckers on the long trips! Convenient, my advice use trash bags in it before use and add half a gallon of water and drop one of bio blue deodorant packs in it, and you are set, the led really helps, if you want the seat to feel more comfortable, get you one of them swimming pool noodles cut it to fit around the inside bucket lip, cover with plastic bag and put your seat on it for maximum comfort! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Dea Abraham

customer_reviews.title: In case of an emergency...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should own one. We have one bathroom and the toilet wasn't flushing. We were waiting for a repair man but the pipe was the issue. It would be days before it was fixed. So I bought this... Thank God for prime shipping because it came fast! We no longer have to go to the supermarket to use the bathroom. I did purchase the bags as well and a jug of cheap cat litter. Which thanks to another review really helped. After using the potty you just put some cat litter on top and carry on. It was easy to dispose of and a lot less embarrassing than going to a store every few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: An excellent place to keep all your crap and juices.
customer_reviews.text: I'm retired and live in a guesthouse with another six residents, and there are only 11⁄2 bathrooms in the house...so since I have my own bedroom, I've opted instead to use my own private facility and avoid contracting everyone else's germs. It has served me very well for the past 9 months, and hopefully 'til the day I croak.
customer_reviews.author: Werewolf69

customer_reviews.title: Seat platic is too thin - seat crushes
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for years on my boat. I was very pleased with it. The old one got damaged (not the product's fault), and I bought a new one. The new one had a seat that was so thin that it would crush and permanently deform (no - I have no gained weight). I'm ordering a new one in case they had a bad batch, or maybe the one I bought was a Chinese knock-off copy.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt. Pat

customer_reviews.title: Slip, slide, stick. Still great.
customer_reviews.text: Great generally. Good odor control, capacity, ease, and manage bag removal. Except, haha...toilet seat sticks to skin and lifts when you stand. Difficult to keep that seat in the very short slot, it shifts with just a touch. In the dark camping, takes finesse. Also, just a few inches taller, wider, and and most adult males could sit on it. As it is, ideal for under 5'8" and 140lbs...or kids that have good eye hand coordination. Dsigners, two small plastic squeeze clips along slot couldd fix issue? I'm thinking removable putty pushed in slot might grip enough to prevent slipping seat and this sitter.
customer_reviews.author: m l

customer_reviews.title: Immediately returned. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I guess this "might" work for children or very skinny adults but for average size to heavier adults...... not so much. It's actually not a bad product but like others have mentioned it had one design flaw that ruins it. The seat part is made of VERY thin plastic and flattens out when you sit on it causing the seat to slide off the base. A solid seat with a more secure connection to the base and this would be a 5-star product. I ended up returning mine for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy with a very small opening.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have the butt of a 5 year old, this will get messy very quickly for you. Also, if you weigh more than 50lbs the feeling like it’s going to collapse is always there.
customer_reviews.author: Smudger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for using in a camper van. The size and useability is what was a necessity for us. It fits perfectly behind the bench seat in the back of my conversion van. The height is tall enough to not be uncomfortable or hard to use for a senior. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Bryant

customer_reviews.title: It works for us and it's relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly the right size and shape for the available space in our boat, so that makes it ideal for us. However, the top won't stay securely fastened - I actually use a bungee cord across the top to keep it closed tightly. At this price I really didn't expect it to be well-engineered, and I was right. It works, and that's all I was really hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Reilley

customer_reviews.title: Great for boating or other outdoor activities
customer_reviews.text: Love my boat potty! The seat is comfortable enough to ride on. This is the second order for me because my husband was going too fast on the boat and the lid(s) flew off and we lost the seat. Just ordered this one and will use Velcro to secure the top to avoid this in the future. I wanted one after using my friend's on her boat. It's better than hanging over the side and a bit more discreet.
customer_reviews.author: Downtown Dahlgren

customer_reviews.title: Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has a horrible odor. It was received and opened new, and did not appear to be used (as some others have said), but we immediately noticed a strong offensive odor. It was so bad we couldn’t stand to have it open. We tried but can’t even use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Only improvement would be a locking lid. Worked well otherwise. My girlfriend was super skeptical but ended up liking it. Buy the bags and put kitty litter with fragrance in sandwich bags. After each use dump in a bag of litter for a mess and oder free experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lister

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised that this worked so well and conveniently. I am 300 lbs and it held me no problem. It also holds everything of mine that it is supposed to, if you know what I mean. My 10 year old daughter approved of it. No smell inside my Jeep, won't tip over like a Homer bucket, had a holder specifically for the TP....
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tate

customer_reviews.title: So simple yet so effective!
customer_reviews.text: I just moved into a home needing reno so I purchased this and a small bag of pine chips for a couple bucks. I honestly can’t believe how well it works and how there’s zero smell. Granted I go #1 elsewhere and don’t mix urine but for #2 it’s unbelievably effective. I told my loved ones it’s so simple and we almost are going backwards with regular toilets vs simple composting ones like this. Zero waste, zero water, zero bill. Too bad I’ll soon be installing a real toilet in my home but this will definitely stay with me for camping and emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd invented this!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd invented this! Works great for camping in a tent. Gave me piece of mind knowing that I didn't have to take a walk to the restroom in the middle of the night. I did what one reviewer said and put double heavy duty trash bags in it and put some kitty litter in the bottom. Great idea, and you just have to throw out the kitty litter bag the next morning. When I'm not camping in the winter, I can use it for storage. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: KST

customer_reviews.title: This is just perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect for me. I bought it because I made the mistake of transporting the last one I had, (for years), in the back of an open truck. Lid and seat blew away. I think the thing I like the most is its sturdy support when used and the lid that closes off any odor.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson C Shane

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Hard to post about a portal potty...but this puppy solved my problem. Spent one week getting my one and only bathroom repaired. This saved the day. I'm 5'9" and weight over 200 lbs. This with Reliance bag solved my problem. AND..since then I had a broken pipe and used it again while it was fixed.
customer_reviews.author: JAF56

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't think of a creative headline, sorry - but it's a great product
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I mean really....it's a porta-potty, it works. Anything more is probably TMI, but if you want to know more, here ya go: We have an RV setup on some property which has one bathroom hooked up to septic. We often have visitors who stay in a tent or popup, but no bathroom unless they use ours. We set this up in a barn stall and they have their own private toilet. It also gives us a second toilet for those times when you have two people who need it at the same time (coffee time in the morning....).
customer_reviews.author: ReidalongTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So handy for camping
customer_reviews.text: We use this to put in our tent at nite. No more zipping and unzipping the tent and having to find your shoes to go outside to the restroom. Also great for when you can't get a spot close to the restroom and the walk is too far. I am old and have to pee every little while during the night. This handy thing has just been great for me. Just throw a big trash bag in there and you are go to..... go.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Potty
customer_reviews.text: The good thing about CA backroads is that they are beautiful The bad news is that you can get caught in enormous traffic jams, and there are no toilets - public or even a business. This is perfect for your small crossover (unlike the big bucket one in REI or Dick's) and used with a privacy tent, you are all set to take a bio break. It didn't break under a load of 175 lb weight - but it could for heavier folks. I don't have the data
customer_reviews.author: Maha-Guru

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Product looks good so far however the lid is a little flimsy. A little smaller and bulkier than expected. Haven't had the chance to try it out yet but hopefully it works good.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Best portable toilet
customer_reviews.text: Have used the hassock for several camping trips. I like it much better than expensive portable toilets that I have used in the past. The set up and cleaning is so much easier. It is no problem to transport and store due to light weight. The only negative is that, after the first new use, I do not put the paper holder back because it can become soiled. Once soiled the challenge is what to do with that piece when "nature calls". I may do away with the paper holder and find another way to store the paper so it is ready-to-use. I would definitely recommend this has the first choice for anyone wanting a portable toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great simple portable toilet
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and reasonably comfortable. The lid keeps smells at Bay, so it can live inside. Once you pull the lid off it can get a bit pungent quickly, however. It depends how often you empty it, and how much kitty litter or absorbent gel you use. The "Double Doodie" bags don't hold much. They need to be changed after 5 or so uses. I'd recommend using plain old heavy duty kitchen bags instead (double bag it!), and sprinkle some kitty litter in after each use. Then you don't have to change the bags so often. Perfect for camping, and to avoid covid-infested restrooms when traveling by car.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W.

customer_reviews.title: Makes Best Sense For the Dollar
customer_reviews.text: After looking into options for a portable toilet when we travel in our SUV, this made the most sense for the dollar. Chances are we won't use if there are other feasible options and if we did have to use it, we would do our business and easily dispose of the waste without cleaning, storing of water and lugging around a larger device in our vehicle. We bought the disposable bags, some deodorized kitty litter and some wet wipes and we are ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: It will serve the purpose adequately enough, but it’s not as sturdy as I thought it would be. The seat, the lid part that is the paper holder, the cover and the base itself are all thin, flimsy plastic. It also sits lower than a standard toilet by several inches, so if you have difficulty standing from a squat this probably not a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: The product works for the needed purpose but is a ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works for the needed purpose but is a little short for taller people. I have knee problems and had some issues getting off this small toilet. Also the overall product does not withstand ratcheting straps very well. I have used it on two long overland trips now but those are my only complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Z_Swend

customer_reviews.title: Save a camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a camping trip as it is difficult for some to reach the restroom. Set up was easy. I just use a normal kitchen trash bag (well two) and some kitty litter. The camping trip was 4 days and the toilet was used by 4 people in 100 plus degree weather. No smell came out of this thing the whole time. I have used the toilet for other events and this thing has not let me down. I will tell others about this product. If you are an outdoors person or family you or may you like to travel by car this toilet is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Oaktownchick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I use this while camping in areas that are not official campgrounds, so there has only been one option in the past. This worked so well, I almost wished I had to go more than once a day. Not to be too graphic, but in completing the paperwork, it is necessary for one to lean to one side or the other to gain access. I felt this might tip over, so I used a standing crouch, a little inconvenient, but FAR FAR better than the old hole in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: FresnoDick

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic seating 😃
customer_reviews.text: There is no softness everything is hard plastic minus your selection of toilet paper. Easy to use and maintain in sanitary condition. The advertisement shows grey lid seat and toilet paper holder. The grey color leads to an assumption that the seat is soft foam. The one I received is all black parts for lid, toilet paper holder, and seat and is entirely all hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: I’m a trucker and I need this bad boy when I’m in the middle of nowhere
customer_reviews.text: It’s as advertised. I’m a trucker and I need this bad boy when I’m in the middle of nowhere, it’s comfortable and just the right size. When your done tie up the bag and put it in the trash. Please put it in the trash not on the side of the road!! Don’t be what your throwing away !
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Small, convenient and it works!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on our last camping trip. I purchased the bio-bags to burry. I placed kitty litter on the bottom of the bucket to catch anything that may have leaked from the bags. Fortunately, I had no issues with the bags and no leakage. We had no issues with the toilet collapsing or breaking. Worked fine for our 5 day off road trip. I like the way the whole thing went together and was very convenient to use and setup. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: a good product! I bought another one!
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was "oh no, cheap plastic" but after giving it a chance and testing out, I have changed my mind. It's a good buy for the price. Very easy to use, clean, and compact. The place to store toilet paper is useful. Unwanted smells can be nearly eliminated, if you add a small amount of cheap kitty litter (dollar store brand would do!) on top of the waste and close the lid. I tested for three days with this method and no smell. Not heavy at all and can easily be transported. No time consuming clean up! Big enough for adults and small enough for children. Best for camping, RV backup, home emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This worked great camping for 4 days
customer_reviews.text: This worked great camping for 4 days! We had about 10 people using it ranging from a 45# 3 yr old to 220# adult men use it. We got bag and used cat litter and it worked like a charm but remember to change it at least twice a day with that many using it cause it will get heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Key compnent is flimsier then it should be
customer_reviews.text: Close but no cigar. The outside container is fine . What really disappointed me was the very thin (Tupperware container thin) Seat section that you actually sit on. I expected a thick, if not solid, toilet seat to sit on. This Unit has a thin seat that rests on the Main container, it doesn't even rest into anything on the container. We are not big people and I think the females are going to have to do a balancing act as they try to negotiate the small opening. The picture shows it looking more robust then it is
customer_reviews.author: Theresa H.

customer_reviews.title: The only light weight camp toilet you will ever need.
customer_reviews.text: The small size and portability of this toilet is what you want to choose. Super easy to use, and clean. It will fit in your tent and act as a table when not in use. I've had this one for over a decade now with no problems. Also great for the home when the water gets cut off. I use a trash bag with kitty litter when its needed. Its very light weight. When not in use put some camping gear in it.
customer_reviews.author: P36jet

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and the flat seat cover makes a good little table..
customer_reviews.text: As gross as that sounds, it does make a good little table when you are short on space living in your SUV. AND it does the job as I mentioned. But the seat slides around too much and sticks to your butt so you have to hold it down when you get on and back off again. I have to figure out something to make the seat more 'grippy' to on the base. Maybe a bead of epoxy..?
customer_reviews.author: Natasha W.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and simple clean up
customer_reviews.text: We've used the potty a few times now, get some kitchen garbage bags to line the pail and bring along some kitty litter to toss in after each use. Only improvement would be a little sturdier seat, I'm 200# and the seat plastic is a little thin and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: the waterboy

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: The seat is comfortable, everything is top quality. My tall, heavy man-frame was able to sit on it with no problem. I even benefited from the squatting position it forced me to use. The only negatives for me were: the awkward shape made it difficult to fit in my car trunk, which resulted in some bending in the lid. And after I cleaned it out at the site and got it home, it still smelled a bit like sewage. I used 13-gal garbage bags, so maybe the 2-dollar apiece camping bags made for this would have helped this issue some, but trash bags are so much cheaper! Happy camping!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Big enough to do the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Big enough to do the job, small enough to store easily. We use regular kitchen garbage bag in the inside bucket, with a baggie worth of kttie litter for a day out on the boat... pull the bag out at the end of the day, put the lid back on and you're set. SO much easier tahtn the dual tank water flushing style... and just as effective. Very light weight for loading and unloading the boat too. overall, very satisifeid.
customer_reviews.author: tdwarnke

customer_reviews.title: great price, 1 small flaw
customer_reviews.text: the seat is super thin and flimsy. i had to pour a quart of epoxy resin to fill the seat's hollow underside, in order to correct this. you won't go through the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: not what expected
customer_reviews.text: very small my butt is apparently to big for it, might fit a small child. Also doesn't feel very sturdy for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this for anyone over 125 lbs
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried this it felt like it was going to collapse and I only weigh 140 lbs. I immediately replaced this with a much, much sturdier brand for not that much more money
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bag changing is easy - no mess
customer_reviews.text: No real complaints. this thing works as advertised. it's a little low to the ground for me (6'4" 220lbs) and not really built for larger people. But, I really just got it for the wife and kids when we're camping and it works perfectly for that!! Bag changing is easy - no mess... the TP holder is a little silly but it does work i guess. It doesn't really work as a TP holder - more of a place to put the roll when you are done - to keep it off the ground... Meaning, you cant really pull sheets of TP off while it's in the holder. The lid seems to keep the smell locked inside. Good Buy
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Small but works
customer_reviews.text: So we used this a few times on our last camping trip. Worked ok, it says same hiegth as of a normal toilet, maybe for a child's restroom. Its about 3 inches smaller then a normal toilet. We used plastic bags with some cat litter which makes clean up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes ya just gotta go!!
customer_reviews.text: Im a female truck driver. Ive been so for almost 15 years. This was a great purchase. Its simple to use strong and big enough for an adult but small enough to be discrete. Place a liner in (trash bag) and dispose when finished. Great price and a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described. 😊
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. They work exactly as stated. I like the smell of the sample pack. Keeps oder to a minimum. I like that they are fatter than a normal bucket so it's harder to knock it over. I was disappointed that the seat wasn't padded but my husband says what do you expect its for camping at least you don't have to use a bush. Lol. So true. All in all great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J kinney

customer_reviews.title: It's fine.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others that it's lightweight, but it's sturdy enough for me. I take it camping and use 2 grocery plastic bags and kitty litter in it. Not smelly and a lifesaver when you really need to go and a bathroom isn't available.
customer_reviews.author: S Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Super convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping with kids! Light weight and great for road side pull offs in a rush! I used plastic bag liners in the can and changed out after each go! Worked great, stayed clean and sanitary. Perfect solution to kids fearing going outside! Other camp potties are double and triple the price and weight!
customer_reviews.author: Utahsheather

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful thing to keep in a truck or van
customer_reviews.text: I keep it in my van, ready for a dump. I'm 69 and 1/2 years old and you never know when you are in need of a toilet. I walk around a lake at a park and walking will loosen your bowels up. They do have a portalet, but no way. I haven't had to use it yet but I will let you know on my first time. How it felt on my butt and how easy it was to clean up. I know you don't need all this information, but hey we all have a butt, we all sometime or other have to go, I will return to give you all an update on my first time thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Larry French

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and height
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and height. Haven't put it to the test yet, but it is going to make traveling and camping so much more convenient. I read a lot about various products to use as filler. It seems you should fill the bucket (or bag) with 1/3 to 1/2 filler - coconut fiber, pine chips, etc. - the put a small scoop in after each use. They say "fragrance free". We'll see soon. (I ordered a 2.5 cubic ft. pack of large pine chips as in equine stalls!)
customer_reviews.author: Trish Journeys

customer_reviews.title: Load off my mind!
customer_reviews.text: I am more than glad I bought this! It came in handy so many times when we went camping. Lots of camp sites do NOT have restrooms and who wants to poo in the woods? Not me, LOL Anyway it's very sturdy and seals great so you aren't stuck smelling your business.... Great for camping boating family trips that are long... I recommend this item!!!! Get it!!! You won't be sorry. I just use force flex bags in it because it's cheaper than the bags they recommend to buy for it... I got 100 force flex bags at Target for $14.00 vs 20 bags for something like $25.00 which is what they ask every place for the potty bags...
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: This does work but you feel like it is going to give way while you are... you know. It is thin walled and very short. If I had to do over I would have bought the lid that fits a 5 gal bucket. Update: Have to take a star or two away from this one. as feared above this is just not what you want to be sitting on when it gives out... Which happend to us. Side walls just gave out leaving you sitting in a pile of your own $hit. Pass on this one...
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Moutian Man

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, cheap, cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is INCREDIBLY flimsy, looks NOTHING like the picture, and is COMPLETELY overpriced at $29 BUT-it does what it says does. Nothing really positive to say other than it works so 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Customer K

customer_reviews.title: Great for the boat, camping, and long evacuation drives
customer_reviews.text: This has been a LIFESAVER! We originally bought it for camping but during the evacuation for hurricane irma, it saved us many pullover situations. We use a trash liner and then fill it halfway with scoopable cat litter; gives it weight so it doesn't tip over while driving, and contains the waste until you reach a safe stop to change the bag. It's awesome for the boat too; you can't scoop out the "wet" and toss over the side 😂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: When camping away from toilets with women this is your life saver. Easy to keep clean with kitty litter in a bag just tie up the bag and throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Simpson

customer_reviews.title: It works for us
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty much what I expected for this price. It is basically a bucket with a toilet seat on top. It is short, so if you are taller like my spouse and me, just know that it is a test of your squatting ability. It is sturdy enough for a quick sit, but not for a (ahem) reading session. We lined ours with a white garbage bag that we use daily in our kitchen and added some kitty litter. The litter absorbs the moisture and keeps the odor down. For campimg where there is no potty or like what we use it for, night time, its great.
customer_reviews.author: The Ostens

customer_reviews.title: It's OK if You Are a Small Person or a Kid!
customer_reviews.text: If you're a very small adult, or a kid, then this might work for you! Otherwise, there is NO WAY that this thing will fit a normal, or a large, man's backside!!! Either you'll be able to go number 1 in it, while your backside is hanging off the back, or... you'll be able to go number 2, and pee on the floor or ground! Sorry... but it's the truth!!!
customer_reviews.author: 'Doc'

customer_reviews.title: I THINK IT IS A GREAT PRODUCT.  IT HAS 2 LIDS, WHICH MAKE IT ODOR-FREE.
customer_reviews.text: I USE THIS AS A CHAMBER POT IN MY BEDROOM. I HAVE MANY PETS, AND IF I OPEN THE DOOR IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT, THEY ALL RUN IN, AND I HAVE DIFFICULTY SLEEPING. SO, THIS SUITS MY NEEDS PERFECTLY. I CAN PUT A 13 GALLON PLASTIC TRASH BAG IN IT, SO CLEANING IS EASY. AND, I THINK MOST IMPORTANTLY, IT HAS 2 LIDS: THE TOP LID, AND THE LID JUST BENEATH WHICH HOLDS THE TOILET ROLL. WITH BOTH LIDS, THERE IS NO SMELL AT ALL. PERFECT FOR INDOOR USE.
customer_reviews.author: CORINNE T.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and necessary invention for some of us
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been so handy for me. I am a regional truck driver, I stay in the truck for days at a time and sometimes I'm in places where there's no restroom, or in the middle of nowhere. I keep it under my truck bed, and it just been so useful. The only reason I won't give a 5 stars is because it is sturdy but it could be a little more sturdy. I weigh 182 lbs so I'm average not overweight, and It supports me okay but what about those who are heavier than me? Would it support that weight okay and still keep its original shape?
customer_reviews.author: kelvin sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great for the pontoon boat.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes when we go out on the pontoon boat I have to pee. Sometimes the water is too cold. Sometimes the mosquitoes are OUT OF CONTROL. This thing is great. It was recommended by a fellow boater. Its hard plastic not a squishy seat. Doesnt matter though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Dana

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my horse trailer
customer_reviews.text: Have it my horse trailer. Lined with two small trash bags and dumped in wood pellet kitty litter. Works great. I can store extra bags in the outer case where there is no chance of them getting soiled. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HORSE LOVER

customer_reviews.title: surprising comfortable toilet and very packable
customer_reviews.text: This works for remote car camping when you don't want to dig a latrine and have the means to bring this toilet with you. I lined it with a contractors garbage bag and threw in a bunch of kitty litter and some baking soda. Worked great for a long weekend of car camping for 2 adults at a remote site at a national park. Packing it back was easy...put camp garbage in over top...folded back closed and put lid back on...and nothing spilled or smelled in car ride back to dumpster. pack in pack out. keeping campsites cleaner!! would be great if you have kids who can't wait to get to toilet.
customer_reviews.author: nurseychic

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: received the product minus the Eco- fresh packet, and the Bio-Blue
customer_reviews.author: bbucks

customer_reviews.title: No smell!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, finally used this. Used Fresh Steps cat litter and had no odor problem even though it was in the same tiny structure. Problems: it is too low for an adult, so would be better on a sturdy pallet height box. Secondly, the seat is a bit small. Getting a bit too graphic here, using it is not the problem. Wiping one's self, is. But, a little gymnastics solves that. All in all, a great value.
customer_reviews.author: S. Payne

customer_reviews.title: that is absolutely terrible. Item should be described as a used item ...
customer_reviews.text: Product looks disturbingly used without being cleaned and then shockingly resold. For a toilet business, that is absolutely terrible. Item should be described as a used item so as not to deceive customers.
customer_reviews.author: Wanchi Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Good for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my truck and used a couple times. even after throwing out the garbage bag I lined it with it still kept an odor that I couldn’t stand even after wiping it down with Lysol wipes! I ended up throwing it out after a week
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Yermakov

customer_reviews.title: works great! it's a plastic
customer_reviews.text: works great! it's a plastic, light weight pooper!! used it camping this past weekend with the Double Doodie bags!! Easy Peasy!! I did not have need of the t p holder, but it's there if ya need it. (I kept the T P in a pocket in the poop room
customer_reviews.author: Buffy Moon

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend it to anyone who is not that steady on ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed to use this in an emergency soon after purchase. Came in very handy- to say the least. While both my husband and I used it without problems, I would not recommend it to anyone who is not that steady on their feet. I would recommend that they place a sturdy chair next to it to lean or hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it did the job. I bought the extra liners and deodorant packs. It is nice that it has an insert to keep your toilet paper. You can store the other stuff in there too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Solution
customer_reviews.text: This simple solution allowed my traveling companion, a very healthy octogenarian, to quickly pee in the night and go back to sleep. She could have braved the trip from cabin to loo but not without thoroughly waking up to navigate the trip. Clean and no odor. We used each bag for two days. It was hot so any longer and the smell would have not been tolerable. We kept it closed during the day and the lid off at night. It was great for our needs!
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of the manufacturers products. This one is most convenient due to is compact size. Highly recommended for those who do not want to use public toilets during the pandemic. I paired it with one of the collapsible tents. Family likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsylvania Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Portable toilet only not 1 bag included as in past
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will work fine. Didn't include the 1 bag as past reviewers have stated. Glad I bought a set with the purchase so I had it. Would have liked it if top lid could screw onto top for secureness, built in divets on the side are for carrying.
customer_reviews.author: SarahP.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: For about $40, this a great portable “toilet”. I use it in my RV, rather than dealing with the black tank. I use Glad 13 gallon bags and kitty litter to cover up the business. Easy to change out the bags and easy to clean up with Clorox wipes to keep super clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Stidham

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: The overall function is fine. It performs very adequately and is not overly heavy, which is important to me. I am not sure yet about longevity, but it looks like it should hold up to travel and use. Very decent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: it works for me.
customer_reviews.text: it works for me...but if your 175 lbs or above the seat part might be too flimsy for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've used A LOT of port potties on boats, in campers, tents, etc., and I have to say this is the easiest clean up hands down, plus you can use it as a seat or hassock too. I use the trash bag and kitty litter method and empty it every morning after camping. I've paid A LOT more money for porta potties only to have them crack, leak, be difficult to clean, and just be an overall bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: OK.
customer_reviews.text: I'll live with it. I'll use in in emergencies and when the time is needed. Cheaply made. I just should have used a 5 gallon bucket with a swimming pool noodle and that might have "suffice".
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: No smell!
customer_reviews.text: Confession: I use this as my "compost" toilet at my off-grid house. I can use it for up to a week, with some pine kitty litter thrown on top of the bulk waste, and I am not grossed out to use it the next morning. Fascinating. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Beats the "Asian Squat"
customer_reviews.text: For the price I'll keep it, but I wish they made one about 3 in. in dia. bigger, and 2 or 3 in. taller. I'm 6"3- 300, and when I took a practice "Dump", I centered my "Brown-Eye", fine but I had to tuck my tool inside the bucket to keep from watering the seat, bucket, and floor. I will say it beats the "Asian Squat", and will enjoy nature more.
customer_reviews.author: Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love the potty!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, doesn't smell. Could be a lot taller. Might as well squat given this unit is short. End up mounting it on a platform to raise it up and carpeting the platform so ankles don't get skinned up when back up to it. Aside from the height, it's a great product. We only used it at night when we didn't want to get up and trek to a potty. We didn't use the blue powder correctly, but smell wasn't a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: H. S.

customer_reviews.title: Thin Plastic
customer_reviews.text: This couldn't have been constructed of lighter weight plastic. While I'm sure it could be adequate to support weight, the lid flopped around and the toilet paper holder insert is a joke. Returned, just buying a bucket and a seat. The price was just too high to put up with it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what it is
customer_reviews.text: We've been doing a lot of camping and this has been a lifesaver. I did get some plastic bags to line the bucket with for easier clean-up but overall it works well. If you're going to be somewhere without good facilities you should get this. I've even used it in lieu of some of the road-side outhouses we've stopped at. My only real complaint is that it's quite low to the ground, so getting on and off can be tricky.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Decker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ACCESSORY
customer_reviews.text: This little potty has been very useful when camping. I have a teardrop trailer with an add on room that fits over the door so I don’t have to hike to a camp outhouse or restroom. I love having it available!!!
customer_reviews.author: Coquelicot

customer_reviews.title: Better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I’ve never used one before but went to a campground w my toddler and needed a place to pee when she was asleep since I can’t leave her alone. I used it for her diapers too, and w kitty litter in the bottom it was easy to keep clean! (I only used 1 cup of litter.) I think I’m going to take this to an upcoming music festival to avoid the porta potties!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Vannorman

customer_reviews.title: Great for car or camping
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size about 2 inches smaller than 5 gallon bucket.
customer_reviews.author: jon28205

customer_reviews.title: Everybody does it!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but it will meet my needs. However the grand kids ages (1&3) are fascinated with it! Lol They are all about potty at this age. Will use for nighttime in my tent or even plumbing emergencies at home.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

product_meta.title: Reliance Products Hassock Portable Lightweight Self-Contained Toilet
product_meta.description: Hassock portable Toilet features a lightweight design and is self-contained. It has a contoured seat for "at-home" Comfort. There is a removable inner bucket for quick and easy waste disposal. It also has a an inner splash cover/toilet paper holder. It is ideal for for hunters, campers and boaters.
feature_bullets: Portable, lightweight and self-contained toilet; comes with one eco-fresh packet
Contoured seat for comfort; Inner splash cover/toilet paper holder
Removable Inner bucket for waste Disposal; compatible with reliance's standard Double doodie bag
Dimensions: 14.7 by 14.7 by 14 inches (L x w x H); weight: 5 pounds
Designed for camping and boating; five-year warranty against manufacturer's defects

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
